pullRequest.title: [DOC] Update to Overview for MirrorMaker 2.0
pullRequest.bodyText:
Signed-off-by: prmellor pmellor@redhat.com
Type of change
Documentation
Update to Overview to describe MirrorMaker 2.0
Kafka component interaction Image showing the Kafka components will be updated to remove 'consumer' and 'producer' from MirrorMaker object.
Checklist
Please go through this checklist and make sure all applicable tasks have been done

 Update/write design documentation in ./design
 Write tests
 Make sure all tests pass
 Update documentation
 Check RBAC rights for Kubernetes / OpenShift roles
 Try your changes from Pod inside your Kubernetes and OpenShift cluster, not just locally
 Reference relevant issue(s) and close them after merging
 Update CHANGELOG.md

commit.message:
Update to Overview for MirrorMaker 2.0

Signed-off-by: prmellor <pmellor@redhat.com>

nodes.bodyText: This sentence looks a bit weird here, because the chapter seems to be about Mirror Maker 1. Is it here intentionally?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,9 +5,17 @@
 [id="configuration-points-topic_{context}"]
 = Kafka MirrorMaker configuration
 
-To set up MirrorMaker, a source and destination Kafka cluster must be running.
+To set up MirrorMaker, a source and target (destination) Kafka cluster must be running.
 
-MirrorMaker requires:
+You can use {ProductName} with MirrorMaker or MirrorMaker 2.0.
+
+[discrete]
+== MirrorMaker
+
+MirrorMaker uses producers and consumers to replicate data across clusters.
+MirrorMaker 2.0 is based on the Kafka Connect framework, _connectors_ managing the transfer of data between clusters.

nodes.bodyText: A MirrorMaker 2.0 MirrorSourceConnector custom resource replicates topics...
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -16,6 +23,25 @@ Consumer and producer configuration includes any authentication and encryption s
 
 A _whitelist_ defines the topics to mirror from a source to a target cluster.
 
+[discrete]
+== MirrorMaker 2.0
+
+MirrorMaker 2.0 is based on the Kafka Connect framework, _connectors_ managing the transfer of data between clusters.
+
+MirrorMaker 2.0 uses:
+
+* Source cluster configuration to consume data from the source cluster
+* Target cluster configuration to output data to the target cluster
+
+A MirrorMaker 2.0 `MirrorSourceConnector` replicates topics from a source cluster to a target cluster.

commit.message:
review edits DL + new Kafka component interaction image

Signed-off-by: prmellor <pmellor@redhat.com>
